ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: what you are promised is certainly true -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Verily the promise made to you is true:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: surely what you are being warned against is true,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: that what you are promised is certainly true
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Undoubtedly, the promise you are given is surely true.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, that which you are promised is surely true.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What you are threatened with is most surely true,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: surely that you are promised is true,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! that wherewith ye are threatened is indeed true,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: What you are promised is certainly true:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily that wherewith ye are threatened is surely true.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: indeed what you are promised is true,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily that which ye are promised is true;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, that which you are promised (i.e. Resurrection in the Hereafter and receiving the reward or punishment of good or bad deeds, etc.) is surely true.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: indeed, that which you are promised is true,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: What you are promised is true.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, what you are promised is true.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:5] assuredly what you are promised (mā, ‘what’, relates to the verbal action), in other words, the promise given to them of resurrection and other matters, is true, is indeed a true promise,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! that wherewith ye are threatened) regarding the resurrection (is indeed true) will indeed take place,
